content: [hakon] Good enough. Much resistance from the governor?
[hakon] I could crush that boy's skull with one hand...
[hakon] It'll have to do. Much resistance from the governor?
[hakon ludin] If they're here then something has gone wrong at Schlid. And you shouldn't be here.
[hakon ludin] We're not watchmen for the world. Watch your tone.
[hakon narrator] Let's go. I'm sick of looking at this dump.
[hakon] Regardless, the governor will have to get over it unless he wants dredge crawling through his streets.
[hakon] We've put down every slag that has wandered through here while you were gone.
[ludin] Either take us through the Wandering Road, or do your job and slaughter some dredge.
[ludin] Enough flapping of mouths, then.
[ludin mogr] To the depths with that old bastard and his lackeys.
/=Ludin turns abruptly with a scowl. He stamps back to his ring of tents and followers.=/
[ludin] We would only be made to do this again later. And I will not suffer it all a second time.
[ludin] What do you expect me to do? Go back to my father and tell him one varl died, so the alliance is over?
[ludin] Why? Aren't you the fabled dredge killers? How did you let them get this far south?
[mogr] Glad to hear it. Give the word and we'll set off.
[mogr] Good. Give the word and we'll set off.
[mogr] Got the impression he wasn't too impressed by our visit. A man named Eirik had something to say about each request I made.
[mogr] Hakon?
[mogr hakon] Hakon?
[mogr hakon] Wandering Road's not an option with this many.
[mogr] Hakon. We're back.
[mogr hakon] What do I tell the warriors, Hakon?
[mogr hakon] What do I tell the warriors, Hakon?

content.option: Tell them to be cautious. No more losses.
Tell them we cover the mountainside in dredge bodies.
Tell them we don't stop until Schlid is retaken.

content: [mogr] He also insisted we take on a lackey of his to watch over his "property". A man named Eirik.
[mogr] I was able to get about as many warriors from Strand as you wanted, and more weapons. Extra supplies, too.
[mogr] I wasn't able to get as many warriors from Strand as you wanted, and only half as many weapons.
[mogr] I was saying the varl we sent to Strand have returned. The governor gave us most of what we wanted.
[mogr ludin] You're sure that wound has healed, Ludin?
[mogr] Some. I don't think he was happy about us buying his fighters using his own money.
[mogr] Will do. Give the word and we'll set off.
[narrator] Eirik? I met him. He seemed competent enough.
[narrator] Eirik? I met him. Didn't care for him.
[narrator hakon] If Ludin won't be deterred, you'll have to deal with it. Don't let Ludin get to you.
[narrator hakon] Or worse.

content.option: They're right, Ludin. Return to Strand. Go home.
Vognir's dead. There's no reason to stay.

content: [narrator] He has a point. As Vognir's kendr you have the same responsibilities, Hakon.
[narrator] I agree. Enough has already gone wrong. If something happens to the prince on a mission of peace... the alliance would rot.
[narrator] Or worse.
{skip} mark1=hakon mark2=mogr mark3=narrator mark4=ludin
/=You perk up, just now realizing Mogr has been talking to you. Since Vognir died everyone has been looking to you to make the decisions. It's exhausting.=/
